Class SimpleGinRummyPlayer

java.lang.Object
SimpleGinRummyPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
GinRummyPlayer
public class SimpleGinRummyPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements GinRummyPlayer
Implements a random dummy Gin Rummy player that has the following trivial, poor play policy: Ignore opponent actions and cards no longer in play. Draw face up card only if it becomes part of a meld. Draw face down card otherwise. Discard a highest ranking unmelded card without regard to breaking up pairs, etc. Knock as early as possible.
Version:

    • reportDraw

      public void reportDraw​(int playerNum, Card drawnCard)
      Description copied from interface: GinRummyPlayer
      Report that the given player has drawn a given card and, if known, what the card is. If the card is unknown because it is drawn from the face-down draw pile, the drawnCard is null. Note that a player that returns false for willDrawFaceUpCard will learn of their face-down draw from this method.
      Specified by:
      reportDraw in interface GinRummyPlayer
      Parameters:
      playerNum - - player drawing a card
      drawnCard - - the card drawn or null, depending on whether the card is known to the player or not, respectively.

    • getDiscard

      public Card getDiscard()
      Description copied from interface: GinRummyPlayer
      Get the player's discarded card. If you took the top card from the discard pile, you must discard a different card. If this is not a card in the player's possession, the player forfeits the game.
      Specified by:
      getDiscard in interface GinRummyPlayer
      Returns:
      the player's chosen card for discarding

    • getFinalMelds

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Card>> getFinalMelds()
      Description copied from interface: GinRummyPlayer
      At the end of each turn, this method is called and the player that cannot (or will not) end the round will return a null value. However, the first player to "knock" (that is, end the round), and then their opponent, will return an ArrayList of ArrayLists of melded cards. All other cards are counted as "deadwood", unless they can be laid off (added to) the knocking player's melds. When final melds have been reported for the other player, a player should return their final melds for the round.
      Specified by:
      getFinalMelds in interface GinRummyPlayer
      Returns:
      null if continuing play and opponent hasn't melded, or an ArrayList of ArrayLists of melded cards.

    • reportFinalMelds

      public void reportFinalMelds​(int playerNum, java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Card>> melds)
      Description copied from interface: GinRummyPlayer
      When an player has ended play and formed melds, the melds (and deadwood) are reported to both players.
      Specified by:
      reportFinalMelds in interface GinRummyPlayer
      Parameters:
      playerNum - player that has revealed melds
      melds - an ArrayList of ArrayLists of melded cards with the last ArrayList (possibly empty) being deadwood.
